To associate a file extension with on Windows:
Go to the Windows Start menu and open Control
Panel.
Go to Default Programs.
Click Associate a file type or protocol with a program.
Click the file extension you want to associate with , then click the Change program button.
In the subsequent dialog box, browse for and choose .

To associate a file extension with on Mac OS:
In Finder, select a file and from the contextual menu select Get Info.
In the Open With subsection, select Other from the application combo box.
Browse to and select .
Select the Always Open With option, then click Add.
